articles.appOverviewContent:
Construction PM helps you manage construction projects from start to finish. The dashboard gives you a bird's-eye view of all your projects, and you can drill into individual projects to manage phases, documents, photos, and team members.

Key areas:
• Dashboard — Overview of all projects and quick stats
• Projects — Create and manage individual projects
• Timeline — Visual Gantt chart of project phases
• Directory — Manage your staff/contractor contacts
• Notifications — Stay updated on project activity
• Settings — Customize theme, manage templates
articles.firstProjectContent:
To create a project:
1. Go to Projects from the sidebar
2. Click 'New Project' in the top right
3. Fill in the project name, address, and estimated completion date
4. Optionally set a budget
5. Click 'Create Project'

Once created, you'll be taken to the project overview page where you can add phases, invite team members, and start tracking progress.
articles.rolesContent:
Construction PM has five user roles:

• Admin — Full access to everything including settings, user management, and all projects
• Project Manager — Can create/edit projects, manage phases, approve documents, and invite members
• Contractor — Access to assigned phases via the Contractor Portal, can upload photos/documents and request reviews
• Stakeholder — Read-only access to project overviews and reports
• Viewer — Basic read-only access

Role determines what actions you can take and what menu items you see.
articles.projectOverviewContent:
The project overview shows:
• Budget summary (total, spent, remaining)
• Progress bar showing phase completion percentage
• Quick stats (active phases, reviews pending, overdue items)
• All phases with status indicators
• Team members and recent activity

Click on any phase to see its detailed view, or use the Timeline link to see the Gantt chart.
articles.budgetTrackingContent:
Set a project budget when creating or editing a project. Each phase can have an estimated cost and actual cost.

The Budget section on the project page shows:
• Phase-by-phase cost breakdown
• Variance (difference between estimated and actual)
• Color-coded warnings when over budget

Admins and PMs can edit phase costs by clicking the edit button in the budget table.
articles.phaseLifecycleContent:
Phases progress through these statuses:

1. Pending — Not yet started
2. In Progress — Active work underway
3. Review Requested — Contractor has requested PM review
4. Under Review — PM is actively reviewing
5. Complete — Phase is finished and approved

Contractors can request reviews from the Contractor Portal. PMs/Admins can change status from the phase detail page.
articles.phaseDependenciesContent:
You can link phases so that one depends on another. This helps with scheduling:

• A dependency means one phase should finish before another starts
• Lag days can be added between dependent phases
• Circular dependencies are automatically prevented
• Dependencies appear on the project timeline

To add a dependency, go to the phase detail page and use the dependencies section.
articles.checklistTemplatesContent:
Admins can create reusable checklist templates in Settings > Checklist Templates. These templates can then be applied to any phase.

To apply a template:
1. Open a phase detail page
2. Look for the Checklist section
3. Click 'Apply Template' and select a template

Checklist items can be checked off by anyone with edit access. When all items are complete, project managers receive a notification.
articles.documentManagementContent:
Upload documents to any phase for record-keeping:

• Supported formats: PDF, images, Word docs, Excel, and more
• Documents can be marked as Pending, Approved, or Rejected by PMs/Admins
• Each document shows who uploaded it and when
• You can delete documents you uploaded

Common document types: permits, inspection reports, contracts, change orders, material specs.
articles.progressPhotosContent:
Take and upload photos to document construction progress:

• Photos are attached to specific phases
• Each photo can have a caption
• GPS tagging with map view for field workers
• PMs can flag photos that need attention
• Photos display in a grid with lightbox view

Regular photo documentation helps with inspections, client updates, and dispute resolution.
articles.invitingTeamContent:
To invite someone to a project:
1. Go to the project overview page
2. Find the Team section
3. Click 'Invite' and enter their email
4. Select their role (PM, Contractor, Stakeholder, Viewer)
5. They'll receive an email invitation

Invitations expire after 7 days. You can resend or revoke pending invitations from the team section.
articles.notifChannelsContent:
Construction PM sends notifications through three channels:

• In-app — Badge on sidebar + notification center page
• Email — Sent via email for important updates
• SMS — Text messages for critical alerts (requires phone number)

You can customize which types of notifications you receive on each channel in Settings > Notification Preferences.

Quiet hours let you pause email/SMS during off-hours while still receiving in-app notifications.
articles.phaseCommentsContent:
Each phase has a comment section for team communication:

• Post comments to discuss progress, issues, or questions
• Comments show user avatar, name, and timestamp
• Delete your own comments (Admins can delete any comment)
• Comments appear in reverse chronological order

Use comments instead of external messaging to keep all project communication in one place.
articles.themeCustomizationContent:
Admins and PMs can customize the app appearance:

• Choose from multiple color themes (Blue, Green, Orange, Purple, Red, Teal)
• Upload a company logo
• Set a company name

Theme changes apply to all users in the organization. Go to Settings > Appearance to customize.
articles.securityAccessContent:
Construction PM uses secure authentication:

• Email-based login with magic links or password
• Google OAuth integration
• Session-based authentication
• Role-based access control

Contact your administrator to change your role or if you're locked out of your account.
articles.changeOrdersContent:
Change orders track scope, budget, and schedule modifications during construction.

To create a change order:
1. Open a project and go to the phase detail page
2. Find the Change Orders section
3. Click "New Change Order"
4. Enter a title, description, and cost impact
5. Submit for approval

Change order statuses:
• Draft — Being prepared, not yet submitted
• Pending — Submitted and awaiting PM/Admin review
• Approved — Accepted; cost automatically added to phase and project budgets
• Rejected — Declined with optional reason

Approved change orders are reflected in the budget section as "Approved COs" and the adjusted budget total updates automatically.
articles.dailyLogsContent:
Daily logs capture day-to-day construction activity for record-keeping and compliance.

Each log entry includes:
• Date of the log entry
• Weather conditions
• Crew size and hours worked
• Work performed description
• Safety incidents or concerns
• Visitor log

To add a daily log:
1. Open the project detail page
2. Navigate to the Daily Logs section
3. Click "Add Daily Log"
4. Fill in the fields and save

Daily logs are visible to Admins, Project Managers, and assigned Contractors. Use them to maintain an accurate project history.
articles.inspectionsContent:
Track quality inspections and code compliance checks for each phase.

To record an inspection:
1. Open a phase detail page
2. Find the Inspections section
3. Click "New Inspection"
4. Enter the inspection type, inspector name, and date
5. Record the result: Pass, Fail, or Conditional
6. Add notes and any required follow-up items

Inspection results:
• Pass — Phase meets all requirements
• Fail — Issues found that must be corrected
• Conditional — Passes with conditions that need to be met

Inspection history is maintained for compliance documentation and audit trails.
articles.materialsContent:
Track materials ordered, delivered, and installed for each phase.

To add a material entry:
1. Open a phase detail page
2. Find the Materials section
3. Click "Add Material"
4. Enter the material name, quantity, unit cost, and supplier
5. Set the initial status

Material statuses:
• Ordered — Purchase order placed
• Delivered — Received on site
• Installed — Incorporated into the build
• Returned — Sent back to supplier

Tracking materials helps monitor supply chain progress and costs.
articles.subcontractorBidsContent:
Manage competitive bids from subcontractors for project phases.

To request bids:
1. Open a phase detail page
2. Find the Subcontractor Bids section
3. Click "Request Bid"
4. Enter the scope description and deadline
5. Invite subcontractors to submit proposals

Bid management:
• Review submitted bids side by side
• Compare costs, timelines, and qualifications
• Accept the winning bid and notify participants
• Rejected bidders receive automatic notifications

Only Admins and Project Managers can manage bids.
articles.offlineModeContent:
Construction PM works even when you lose internet connectivity — perfect for job sites with poor signal.

How it works:
• The app detects when you go offline and shows an indicator in the header
• You can continue making changes (updating phases, adding comments, toggling checklists, etc.)
• Changes are saved to a local queue on your device
• When you reconnect, queued changes automatically sync to the server

The offline indicator shows:
• Number of pending changes waiting to sync
• Sync progress when reconnecting
• A retry button if any changes fail to sync

All 28 mutation actions work offline, including phase updates, comments, checklist toggles, photo flags, document status changes, and more.

Tip: The app caches pages you have visited, so previously loaded project data is available offline.
articles.analyticsDashboardContent:
The analytics dashboard provides visual insights into project performance.

Available widgets:
• Budget overview — Total spend vs. budget across all projects with progress bars
• Phase status distribution — Pie chart showing how phases are distributed across statuses
• Activity timeline — Recent project activity plotted over time
• Project health — At-a-glance health indicators for each active project

Access analytics from the Dashboard page. Widgets update in real time as project data changes.

Admins and Project Managers see analytics for all projects. Contractors see only their assigned project data.
articles.gpsPhotosContent:
Photos can be tagged with GPS coordinates to record exactly where on the job site they were taken.

To use GPS photos:
1. When uploading a photo, allow location access if prompted
2. The GPS coordinates are automatically embedded in the photo metadata
3. Tagged photos appear on an interactive map view in the Photos section

The map view shows:
• Pin markers at each photo location
• Click a pin to see the photo thumbnail and details
• Cluster markers when multiple photos are in the same area

GPS tagging requires location permissions in your browser or device. Indoor photos may have less accurate positioning.
articles.clientPortalContent:
The Client Portal gives project owners and stakeholders a read-only view of their project without needing a full account.

How it works:
• Admins and PMs generate a unique access token for each client
• Share the token link with the client
• Clients can view project progress, budgets, photos, and documents
• No login required — the token provides secure, scoped access

Client portal features:
• Project overview with progress and budget summary
• Phase status and timeline view
• Photo gallery
• Document downloads

Tokens can be revoked at any time from the project settings.
articles.bulkImportContent:
Import multiple records at once using CSV files to save time on data entry.

Supported import types:
• Projects — Create multiple projects from a spreadsheet
• Staff/Contacts — Import your team directory
• Phases — Add phases to a project in bulk

To use bulk import:
1. Download the CSV template from the import dialog
2. Fill in your data following the template columns
3. Upload the completed CSV file
4. Review the preview and confirm the import

The import validates data before processing and reports any errors. Only Admins can perform bulk imports.
articles.twoFactorAuthContent:
Add an extra layer of security to your account with two-factor authentication (2FA).

To enable 2FA:
1. Go to Settings
2. Find the Security section
3. Click "Enable 2FA"
4. Scan the QR code with an authenticator app (Google Authenticator, Authy, etc.)
5. Enter the 6-digit code to verify setup

Once enabled, you will need to enter a code from your authenticator app each time you sign in.

If you lose access to your authenticator, contact your Admin to reset 2FA on your account.
articles.apiWebhooksContent:
Integrate Construction PM with external systems using the API and webhooks.

API Keys:
• Generate API keys from Settings > API Keys
• Use keys to authenticate REST API requests
• Keys can be revoked at any time

Webhooks:
• Configure webhook URLs to receive real-time event notifications
• Supported events include: project created, phase updated, document uploaded, inspection completed, and more (16 event types total)
• Webhooks are signed with HMAC for security verification
• Filter which events trigger each webhook

Only Admins can manage API keys and webhook configurations.
articles.budgetForecastingContent:
Budget forecasting helps you predict final project costs based on current spending patterns.

The forecast section on the Budget page shows:
• Projected final cost — Estimated total cost at project completion based on current burn rate
• Cost Performance Index (CPI) — Ratio of budgeted to actual cost; above 1.0 means under budget
• Estimate at Completion (EAC) — Projected total using earned value methodology
• Variance at Completion (VAC) — Difference between budget and projected final cost

Forecasts update automatically as you enter actual costs and complete phases. A green indicator means the project is tracking under budget; red means it is trending over budget.

Use forecasting to make proactive budget decisions before costs spiral.
articles.reportSchedulingContent:
Set up automatic report generation and delivery on a recurring schedule.

To schedule a report:
1. Go to the Reports section
2. Click "Schedule Report"
3. Choose the report type (progress, budget, activity)
4. Select frequency (daily, weekly, monthly)
5. Add email recipients
6. Save the schedule

Scheduled reports are generated automatically and delivered via email. You can pause, edit, or delete schedules at any time.

Only Admins and Project Managers can create scheduled reports.

help.replayIntroDesc: Walk through the app's key features step by step

tour.welcomeDesc: Your all-in-one platform for managing construction projects. Let's take a quick tour of the key features.
tour.welcomeTip: This tour takes about 1 minute. You can skip it anytime.
tour.projectsDesc: Create projects, set budgets, and break work into phases. The Timeline view gives you a Gantt chart showing how everything connects.
tour.projectsTip: Start by creating your first project from the Projects page.
tour.phasesDesc: Each phase tracks status, costs, checklists, documents, and photos. Phases flow from Pending → In Progress → Review → Complete.
tour.phasesTip: Use dependencies to link phases that must happen in sequence.
tour.teamDesc: Invite team members via email with specific roles. Contractors get their own simplified portal for uploading work and requesting reviews.
tour.teamTip: Invite your first team member from any project's Team section.
tour.checklistsDesc: Create reusable checklist templates in Settings and apply them to phases. Upload documents for approval tracking and photos for progress documentation.
tour.checklistsTip: Check Settings > Checklist Templates to set up your first template.
tour.notificationsDesc: Get notified about phase changes, review requests, and completed checklists via in-app, email, or SMS. Customize your preferences in Settings.
tour.notificationsTip: Set up quiet hours to avoid late-night notifications.
tour.contractorWelcomeDesc: This is your Contractor Portal — a focused view of the phases you're assigned to. Let's walk through the basics.
tour.assignedDesc: Your dashboard shows all phases you're assigned to, grouped by status. Click any phase to see its details, checklist, and documents.
tour.assignedTip: Complete checklist items as you finish each task.
tour.uploadDesc: Document your progress by uploading photos and relevant documents to each phase. This creates a clear record for your team.
tour.uploadTip: Take photos regularly — they help during inspections and reviews.
tour.reviewDesc: When you've completed work on a phase, click 'Request Review' to notify the project manager. They'll review and either approve or ask for changes.
tour.reviewTip: Make sure all checklist items are done before requesting a review.
tour.changeOrdersDesc: Track scope changes with formal change orders. When approved, costs automatically roll into your project budget — no manual recalculation needed.
tour.changeOrdersTip: Each change order shows its cost impact before you approve it.
tour.analyticsDesc: Your dashboard shows real-time analytics: budget health, phase progress, and earned value forecasting with CPI metrics to predict if you'll finish under or over budget.
tour.analyticsTip: Check the Budget section for CPI and EAC projections on any project.
tour.offlineDesc: No signal on the job site? No problem. All your changes queue up automatically and sync when you're back online. A status indicator shows pending updates.
tour.offlineTip: Look for the sync indicator in the top bar when you're back online.
tour.offlineContractorDesc: Working without signal? Your uploads, checklist updates, and review requests are saved locally and sync automatically when connectivity returns.
tour.advancedDesc: Share read-only project views with clients via secure token links. Connect your workflow with API webhooks, bulk CSV imports, GPS-tagged photos, and scheduled reports.
tour.advancedTip: Generate a client portal link from any project's Settings tab.
tour.learnMore: Learn more in the Help Center →
